issue.title: incompatibility between sdformat's URDF and github's URDF

message.raw:
You are right and the way to go is to share the code between all consumers. For this, @thomas_moulard already did the job to go into debian (ubuntu will copy packages after that) for the urdfdom packages so it is considering a high priority for OSRF getting this as a system package.

While this happen, and since the kind of bugs is really annoying (sorry for your hair), I would say that the problem could come from sdformat since it is exporting urdf symbols, so your controller is using them from this library instead of from ROS one. Could you give a try to pull request #74.
message.html:
You are right and the way to go is to share the code between all consumers. For this, @thomas_moulard already did the job to go into debian (ubuntu will copy packages after that) for the urdfdom packages so it is considering a high priority for OSRF getting this as a system package.

While this happen, and since the kind of bugs is really annoying (sorry for your hair), I would say that the problem could come from sdformat since it is exporting urdf symbols, so your controller is using them from this library instead of from ROS one. Could you give a try to pull request #74.

issue.title: incompatibility between sdformat's URDF and github's URDF

message.raw: Very good news. Thanks a lot @po1 for the detailed description of the problem and @scpeters for fixing the master branch too.
message.html: Very good news. Thanks a lot @po1 for the detailed description of the problem and @scpeters for fixing the master branch too.
